alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:29PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jefferson County through 600 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of McLouth, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McLouth and Winchester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
